name: Git
para: Git is a free, open-source, and distributed version control system used to track changes in source code during software development. It allows multiple developers to collaborate efficiently on a project without overwriting each other's work. Created by Linus Torvalds in 2005 (the creator of Linux), Git is now the most widely used version control system in the world.

name: GitHub
para: GitHub is a web-based platform that hosts Git repositories and provides tools for version control, collaboration, and project management for developers. Itâ€™s built on top of Git and is the most popular platform for open-source and private code hosting.

name: Vercel
para: Vercel is a cloud platform for deploying frontend web applications quickly and easily. It is optimized for frameworks like Next.js, but also supports others like React, Vue, Angular, Svelte, and even static HTML/CSS.

name: Postman
para: Postman is a collaboration platform and tool for API development. It helps developers build, test, debug, document, and monitor APIs efficiently through an easy-to-use graphical user interface (GUI). It is especially popular for working with RESTful APIs, but also supports GraphQL, SOAP, and WebSocket.
